review: Soft Opening 07/08 6:30PM I enjoyed the Big Turbo, steak fries and cold beer. This is more than a burger joint. It is a sit down full menu family place. Service is great and the meal was very tasty. Monday the 13th is the first day of the grand opening.

I guess I should start by saying that we had just been to a red robin earlier in the week ( maybe two or more years was the previous visit) and that visit left me saddened at how poor quality and cheap tasting this place has become over the last few years. Something has gone wrong over the years! RR used to be really good!  So coming to the soft opening already had points against it but willing to give it a shot. Especially as it was FREE which we totally appreciate. The greeters at the door were over the top funny friendly people, almost good enough to have been hired just for this opening-- seemed staged but either way it was cool. The place is much larger than youwould think once inside. Ordered what they called a pear-tini which was magenta purple and had half a rim of pretzel sized salt on it... gag! It had tequila in it but it was not a margarita...the salt on this was just terrible. Suggested that they use sugar instead and guy (possibly bartender?)told me they cant change the recipe... mmmkk?!?!  Since i normally would have a burger and was already opinionated i decided to go for a different item- Had the bonsai salad- honestly it was really disappointing. Bland iceberg lettuce with old  looking veggies and carrot strings. Dressing was in a shotglass sized cup. The chicken was nothing special. Hey, I totally understand that this is not a 4 - 5 star type place but geeze corporate - hire some people who love cooking food and taste things before they come out, and care what things look like before served. I think for a soft opening everyone did well and were very nice and attentive but I probably wont be returning just cuz I really just think the food is not that good. Again, thank you for providing our famlily dinner!

Went to red robin on a Thursday night. The greeters were great and the service was great. The food was delicious. I had the royal burger with the fried egg. It tasted great and the presentation was excellent.  Wife had the "whiskey" burger and she enjoyed it.  For desert we tried the donuts and it was also delicious.  We will definitely go again.

Food is good, but service is not the best. I have been three times and every time I have had to remind them of my drink (specialty drink like root beer float and freckled lemonade). Just tonight I waited nearly 15 min AFTER they cleared my table before my waitress returned with my check and then another 10 min to get it back. I am on the fence about returning.
Open two weeks and very impressed with the fast service and they do keep a eye out for empty fries and drinks. Will be back for sure

My girlfriend and I came in there on 7/24/15 and Rachael served us, and it was extremely the most horrible service I've had in my life. My girlfriend and I know how customer service should be, to the fact I am a manager, and she's a lead server. It all started with her extremely rude attitude, she was helping the table next to where we were being seated at, when she quickly finish up helping that table and ran to our table to yell at the host, "why did you seat another table in my section." She later came back to take our drink orders, where we ordered a peach tea, and a regular sweet tea. Not knowing that the store only had regular ice tea, which came with sugar packets, that is what she brought out. Usually for my restaurant that I manage, I make sure that all of my servers tell the customer before hand that if they order sweet tea, they would have to mix it would sugar packets.  We than asked for an exchange to just get water instead, by the time she brought the water out, she slammed it onto the table not even bothering saying a word or looking at the table. We thought it would be a one time thing, but instead she did it once more when she brought out the tray of utensils. When she ran the food out, she slammed a hot plate onto the table, and didn't say anything. We felt if she was being prejudice because of being a different race than her, because the couple in the booth next to us, were the same race but she had an excellent attitude, always coming to check on them and having a smile on her face, but when she walked by our table it was always an evil glare on her face. When the check was brought out, the sweet tea that we did not even touch and returned was not taken off the bill. The only plus side to the whole dining experience was being able to talk to the manager and hostess that actually showed that they care. I know it is still a new location and kinks are still being worked out but that was absolutely the most unpleasant dining experience I've had ever encountered.

I'm not sure what is going on with this restaurant but there is way too many staff. Every 5 seconds someone else came along asking if we were ok. Many employees don't look happy to be at work. Poor Richard walked around waiting to bus a table with his empty bucket the whole time we were there. With all that staff they failed to wash off a table between customers..yuck.. I asked an employee about a possible job for my teenager and she strongly advised against it... The food was good, delivered quickly. Our waiter Mitch was awesome and may be the only non zombie employed here.

I went here for the first time today with some friends. It's still rather new for this location. I had lunch there and, of course, ordered a burger. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. The art in the place is fantastic. As for the food, not quite sure. It's my fault for not specifying how I wanted my burger cooked. But, the patties do seem a bit small and thin compared to burgers I have had at other places for the same price.  Overall, it's a nice restaurant and I wouldn't mind going again. However, it's not a favorite.

The food was good what i expected but the drink was watered down vodka & the service mediocre. After eating almost all of her pasta there was a hair in the bottom of her bowl. Since she was finished i just let it go but I told our server it was my neices 2nd birthday & she said oh happy birthday....no song & dance no cake just "oh" we would have gotten better treatment at the chili's around the corner.

Failrly new location on Kuykendahl, we went on a busy Wednesday night. They were running a sample promotion for their lemonade stands in connection with a children's cancer foundation.  It was crowded so we grabbed seats at the bar area. We had a rock star bartender who not only serviced the bar but the tables in the bar area as well. Hubby tried the chilli as an appetizer, amazing! Large chunks of beef and tortilla strips with a bit of a kick spice wise. Overall good food, the service is the real star of the establishment. From the moment you walk in, to the food runners, everyone is nice and personable.

My husband and I ordered a to-go order, we both had a order of bottomless fries and so I ordered us both a second order. I didn't know that yall were going to give us a lot of fries, because the Red Robin in San Antonio barely gave us any. I was really surprised, I told my husband that yall were very generous. My husband walked in their to get our food and the guy said yall had one turkey burger, one double burger, a mac and cheese with broccoli and a shit ton of fries. The lady that I spoke to on the phone was very nice and helpful. We payed with the Gift card that San Antonio Red Robin gave us, because of the poor service, but this Red Robin was really good at their service.

Tasty burger but was no bigger than a drive thru burger. Burger was 8.99 with unlimited fries if that's your thing, drink 2.79. The spinach artichoke dip was great but not worth $7. Won't be back unless I have coupon or special deal.

Freckled Lemonade - overpriced and a bit sweet $4 Pretzel Bites - nothing special probably microwaved - $5 Up charge for sweet potato fries and a dipping sauce - nickel and dimming me $0.75 for dippers & $2 for sweet potato fries Royal Robin Burger - $12 - burger was bland and not medium well as ordered  Egg was not over medium as ordered, burst as soon picked up the burger Bacon was thin and was probably that pre cooked microwaveable kind - very disappointed.   Total cost - $25 + tip  Do yourself a favor and go to JAX or Just Burger for something 3 times as good for half the cost. I am going to give them a second chance...used to love Red Robin.  Staff were very nice put more blame for the food on myself.  Should have sent it back.

We went Saturday for lunch. Waited 10mins for a seat. Waited 15mins and no one came. The people seated after us got their drinks already. I flagged down the manager and she sent us a waitress. The waitress was super sweet and the manager came back to apologize and offer to give us appetizers. I said its ok dont worry about it. We ordered our meals, two adult and a kid's meal. Our meals came but kid's meal didn't. We ordered our burger and asked for medium with an over medium egg on top. Everything came out super well done. We ate while our nephew kept telling us how hungry he was so we gave him our fries. We asked the waitress and she said it's  coming. We were almost done with our meal when the kid's meal came out. By this time, our bottomless fries had hit bottom. The waitress asked if we wanted more, we said yes, it never came. Another waiter passed our table and asked if everything was ok and we told him what happened. I guess he told the manager and she came over and said "i took two burgers off your check because you had to wait 15mins". Excuse me? Seriously?! I told her the rest of my disatifaction but she didn't seem to care. The waitress came back with a $0 check and ask if we want to keep it. No apologies and she STILL didn't refill my fries. So much for bottomless fries! We left a $10 tip on the table and left. I'm not sure what's the deal. Did we come on a wrong day? Is this racism because we're Asain? Is this a Texas thing? I will NEVER be returning!
New location with young wait staff. I'm not very fond of the inside decor at all. The food was decent. It seems like this new location is still ironing out some kinks. I would go back though.
I have given this place a chance twice. Both times I was the only one not to get my food with the others. I waited a minimum of 15 min to eat. Sorry Red Robin, no more ...

I tried this spot one afternoon. This is definitely  a guy's hangout. I had great servers and the food was ok. I had chili cheese fries which were pretty good. I also had the Spanish sangria. It was bitter, not really sweet enough for me. Over all a good place to catch a game and a few beers if that's your thing.

Walked in and sat at the bar everything seemed fine. 2 bartenders and a manager were at the bar... they took about 15-17 minutes to get us a drink and then took our order about 6 minutes later. The food came out and the order wasn't clear when delivered.  We asked for one well done and one medium well.  Overall it's new so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. Food is better here than in the Woodlands for sure

We sat down and never got any service, 15 min later we had to flag down a server, 10 min later we finally got our drinks, 15 min later we were finally able to order, an hour later got our food! By the time we finally got our food we had to pick our daughter up from her sport event, I asked for a box and the check...15 min later I had to go into the actual kitchen to get my own...the manager was there and I asked him for the check, he instead gave me attitude! Do not go if you want a relaxing night out! The managers name was dwaine.

Had a great family dinner tonight! Ambiance is casual and very family friendly. Jasmine our server was very good with kids and on point with drinks! The manager Dwayne was all over the restaurant talking to all the tables, very friendly guy :) Food was on point and hot. Endless fries are a great thing with kiddos. I highly recommend this place anytime of day!

I gave this Red Robin its third star only because I'm slightly obsessed with the BBQ burger. (Can't remember the exact name). But, as others have mentioned, service isn't great. The salads are GROSS. I tried to order a salad one night because I was watching calories.. BIG MISTAKE... I couldn't even finish the thing it was so nasty. My husband got the Ensanada chicken platter... He thought it was disgusting. Looked like the chicken had been heated in the microwave. So long story short, only go here for burgers, and don't expect excellent customer service.

This location is just as good as any Red Robin.  The service isn't the fastest but the food is quality.  The dining area isn't great for large groups, we find ourselves waiting longer with our family of 5.  Besides the slow service, we like this location.   Staff members are always friendly and courteous.
Been seated here for 18 mins now.  No server has even came to our table yet. It's not even busy... Yea. Well go somewhere else
Incredibly slow. This place is practically empty and it took 20 min for someone to ask if we wanted water. My burger was cold and the woman helping us was rude.

I am here by myself and the place isn't as busy as I was expecting.   My blue cheese burger is absolutely perfect.  The service is great and the environment is better than I expected from a Red Robin.   I'm very happy!
service was great and California chicken burger amazing! The place looks small on the outside but lots of room inside!

I've visited this location several times on different days and times and I've always had fast and friendly service. They're known for their burgers so don't expect a variety of menu items. I recommend ordering the teriyaki chicken burger and onion rings if you're not big on beef. Prices are on par with the quality of food. Dinner for two is around $30 on average.

Good food but some of the staff still need some help on timing. We go here often as we live around the corner and we have had servers who are amazing and fast and we have had some that we don't see for a while and a manager ends up assisting. As a family of 5 with 3 small kids, we typically have a short window of opportunity to eat before kids start getting impatient. So timing is everything for us.  Again, we love the food for both us as parents and for our children, just need a little work on service.

Beautiful restaurant. Very new and SUPER clean. Love the Star Wars and Star Trek posters. Bartender, Jasmine, was great, very sweet and attentive. Food was good, love that they have a vegan burger patty option- most places just have a veggie burger made with egg.  I ordered a Boca burger and two beers and my tab was $27, holy crap. Definitely won't be stopping here for a quick lunch again but maybe a family dinner or date night.

I'm doing this review purely based on the " Red Robin Royalty" program (yes, Royalty instead of loyalty).   We were given a membership card loaded with credits from our purchase and told to simply register it online to earn free burgers.  This is true, but the program is VERY invasive.  It requires that you agree to accept prerecorded calls as well as emails.  Opting out ends your membership in the program.   An occasional free burger is not worth this type of invasive program.   I'd rather pay for my own burgers.

This is my favorite Red Robin location because it's not a zoo like some of the larger locations along the freeway (it's a bit more laid back...not such a party atmosphere).  The food here is good.  I usually come with a friend and we each order different burgers and split them so we can try a bunch of different things.  So far I've been 4 times and have never had a bad experience....with food or service.  The burgers are all good, the french fries (regular and sweet potato) are good and the onion rings are good.  The only thing I don't like about it is the prices.  If I come with a friend and we each order a burger and drink (tea) and share an appetizer...our bill usually comes to around $40.  Forty dollars for hamburgers.  I really have NO idea why Red Robin is so expensive.  All I can figure is because it has the word 'Gourmet' in the name.  I haven't seen anything that says they use better beef or organic ingredients or anything else that would justify the price.  There are several other restaurants (semi) nearby who serve 'gourmet' type burgers for about 2/3 the price.  The prices keep me from going as often as I would otherwise.  That's my only issue.

The food was good, a little expensive for what you get though. The service was poor, from being seated by hostess through the wait staff, all below standard.  Needs a lot of help to make people feel good.  Hostess was inconsiderate, told other hostess to seat me in bar but never asked me. I told her when I needed to but they made me feel uncomfortable. Then waited a long time to get order taken, almost never saw him again, had to find him for refill.  Pretty negative experience, not even busy so no excuse

Went to be seated and they would let my 1 year old sit in a high chair because it would "block traffic" and they wanted me to hold her in my lap. Manager was rude and unprofessional, so I got up in left in shock and in disgust.

Good food and good dining experience.  Greeter, waitstaff and manager were all attentive.  If they've had service problems in the past according to other reviews, I saw no signs of that today.  Very pleasant experience.

This is the nicest looking Red Robin I've ever been to. I was blown away with the decor. This location even has a really nice bar section in the middle of the restaurant. Our waitress here was awesome and she let us know that they have over 50 different dipping sauces for our fries. She brought us a couple to sample and i was impressed they all tasted great. I really liked one called the tavern. Had I been rating my past experiences at red robin it would've easily been a 3, nothing too extraordinary. This place gets a 4 due to the experience and decor.

Ate dinner here last night with the family and wasn't impressed.  The service was okay but the food took forever to come out.  We ordered milkshakes, and those took at least 30 minutes to be made.  Our waitress came over about 3 separate times with different excuses why the milkshakes weren't there yet, including that the machine was barely working.  Here's where my biggest issue is.... The TV's in the FAMILY eating area were showing UFC.  I feel this is VERY inappropriate television for children to be watching, and isn't appropriate to be shown in a family environment with many young children in the dining area.    At one point, there were 2 bloody faces being shown and close ups of punching and kicking in the face.  If I ever return, I'll make sure and leave my family and kiddos at home, since to me, this isn't something they need to be exposed to.  It wasn't just one small TV, it was every large screen TV in the family dining area.  Very disappointed in this decision made by Red Robin.

Well...very disappointed! I've always loved Red Robin. We decided not to cook on the 4th...drove 30 minutes to get there . 7 tables /3 waiters...and unbelievable...service was horrible. Food was cold. Order was wrong. Drinks lacked syrup. Got my fries after was finished with burger. Other table members fries and burgers cool..not hot. Now...doubt I'll ever go back. We tried to be nice and did tip but would have been much better if they would have just done their job. That's it.

Just ate at this red robin. A very good experience.  Good food, good, attentive wait staff and clean. What I am most impressed with is the manager. Well, really don't know if he is the manager or owner, but he was great.   When we were getting ready to leave, He came by to ask if everything was to our liking.  We told him we were pleased with everything, but my husband mentioned he was a little disappointed that fried pickles were no longer on their menu.  He said he had some in the back and offered to make them for us. As we were full we said thank you but not at this time.  When we left he was waiting for us with an order of fried pickles to go at no charge.   We were both impressed with him for doing this, which proves he is very customer service oriented   Which is hard to find these days   I sincerely hope this restaurant is successful. He deserves it for his hard work We go there often and he is always there, but this is the first time we actually talked to him.   He aims to please his customers and as a customer I appreciate that!

The food was typical, that's the only reason I'm giving 2 stars. Based on service I would give a 0. Majority of our time was spent waiting for service. Not sure who is running this establishment, but they need to either hire more staff or revaluate the current staff. We won't be returning.

To make a long story short,  this Red Robin does not understand how to prepare a meal for someone with Celiac disease. The longer version: We have come to love eating at Red Robin based primarily on the allergen menu. My wife has Celiac and gets sick with even small amounts of gluten. Today she ordered sweet potato fries as gluten free and was told they would be gluten free, having been fried in a dedicated fryer. After getting the fries and eating a few of them,  she noticed some onion strings in them. After talking with the manager,  we learned that these sweet potato fries were not fried in a dedicated gluten free fryer as initially claimed.  Now we know why my wife has been feeling symptoms of ingesting gluten after eating at this specific location a few times.  Shame on them!  Today is my wife's birthday,  and now she is really upset...

They only get one star because my food was edible and you can't give a zero. More than half the restaurant was empty and they were on a wait, that should have been the first clue. It took forever for us to even be greeted by a server for our drink order. We ordered 2 appetizers and while still waiting for the appetizers to come out our meals came out. We asked where our appetizers were and they said I don't know let me go check. We told them don't bother our meal is here. They then tried to ask if we wanted to box the appetizers up and take them home, we said no. Our waitress looked dumfounded and said well should I just take them off your check, well WTH to you think. We never got our water or tea refilled not even once. Worst experience ever!!! Don't come here!!!

Sat for thirty minutes without drinks or food. Finally gave up and left. One of three tables to do so. It wasn't busy; half full restaurant. This is typical of the place. The manager didn't care and walked off when we told him to cancel our water. Go to the Tomball location.

The worse! My husband picked up a order to go, two spoonfuls of chicken tortilla soup, without any chicken, cold. Ordered a side caesar salad, got two stalks of Romaine that had been grilled. On the menu it says Croutons, a chopped salad, this was slop food I would not give a dog! Called on my land line asked for a manager, was put on hold, from 5:55 til 6:20, called them on my cell phone let the manager hear his damn music playing in on my land line! He did not care about the length of time holding, and denied a call was holding there, when he could hear their music on my land line! Third time we have been screwed by this terrible management! Third time isn't a charm! Goodbye Felicia! Food is pure slop! Don't go there! It is the worse of the worse!

Hostess seated us in a closed section. After 10 minutes, bartender came over for our drink order. Unfortunately, he was also handling carry outs and bar tending for all the servers. I noticed our drinks sitting at the bar, so had the manager come over. He said he was sorry, that the hostess sat us in a closed area. He went to the bar and got our drinks. A waitress came over and took our order. A $14 hamburger. Order was delivered but no napkins or silverware. Got the manager again. Waitress never did come back.  Manager comped our burger and gave us coupon for 2 free burgers.  Don't really know why we went there. Have never really had a good experience. We'll use the free coupon, then we're done.
Really bad, worst pretzels and cheese I ever had, really bad soup, just gross food.  Even the fries were gross.  Hate leaving a bad review but it was almost inedible.

We have eaten at this Red Robin location several times since it opened.  The burgers really are special, there;s a real variety for every taste.  Love the fry seasoning and special sauces.  The service is not perfect, but waitstaff is friendly and we have not had the bad experiences others report.  We will be going again for its consistent quality and convenience.

This was our second attempt to enjoy a burger at the Red Robin.  The same issue, different day!  Understaffed to the point of ridiculous.  20 minute wait to simply be greeted at the table.  Raw burgers came out before the appetizer....they said they gave it to someone else.  1 server covering all the bar, 15+ tables, fixing drinks for the whole restaurant.  The poor girl was over run with no assistance from the manager.  We left and talked to the manager and he said...your right, staffing has been a problem.  We went to Whataburger instead.  Good choice!

I came here with a friend on 2/3/17 and first we sat down and the waiter said heather would be with us never did she get to us 15 min later he came back and asked us if we were ready then took our order forgot our drink did not check on us one time as we ate then I ordered desert and it was frozen solid then and he came back and said he forgot our drink and I asked if my desert was supposed to be frozen he asked the other girl she yells no the managers put it in the deep freezer so sorry we don't have it unfrozen - as he proceeded he took the desert and drink off our tickets Nd she had a attitude rolled her eye as to why we said anything and the water that I did order from the beginning never got a refill and they did give us our desert and drink to go. I appreciate the leap to try n fix it but red Robbin fix your customer service.
Great to see old friends from wunches working here... Service is great and the lettuce face burgers are the best!  Will visit again!

Horrible service!!!!! Walked in today (2/26/2017) at 2:40. Front entrance person was totally inappropriate as a greeter. The establishment was filthy!!! There were 8 tables that were dirty full of eaten food. Used napkins were on the floor! Just disgusting! A group of ladies that had been waiting for a while got up to leave and the host (greeter) and a waiter just laughed. My husband and I got up and walked out! We will NEVER go back to this Red Robin's EVER! Just a nasty place!!!!!!!!!!!

You know how I am behind chain restaurants!  I will admit that my server was extremely attentive.  I'm a huge fan of them having their own seasoning salt at the table because that means you have a possibility of actually having flavored food! I'm also a fan of having many unlimited options.  That includes some fruit, salad and even the fries. Most cool was the unlimited root beer floats! Fries come in a few flavors and you can get premium sauces for dipping.  I opted to get garlic fries with a side of beer cheese, buzzard sauce and sweet pepper Thai sauce. For the main edible, I opted for the A.1. Peppercorn burger. This gourmet burger has hardwood-smoked bacon, melted Pepper-Jack cheese, A.1. Peppercorn Spread, tomatoes and crispy onion straws on a onion bun. My date ordered garlic fries and the Royal Red Robin burger. That is a burger with cheese of your choice melted on it, tomatoes, lettuce,  mayo, bacon and an egg up top.  All in all, the burgers are smaller than what I would expect for $10 or more burgers. In regards of taste, the burgers did have character, but they did not knock my socks off. Having unlimited options will ensure you leave full though. The beer cheese sauce definitely have a taste of beer to it. For this non drinker, I will pass on it next time.  The menu truly is extensive. You can get salmon, burgers, chicken, under 600 calorie meals, etcetera. Many people are coming in to try macaroni and cheese burgers that are new here. Come find something to eat here.  Just for the record, I showed up to redeem my free burger for my birthday. I recommend signing up for their email club.

On a weekend evening, we were greeted warmly by the hostess and seated in a roomy dining room within seconds. Our server was on hand within minutes to take our orders and niftily punch them into our table's computer tablet so that the kitchen would start preparations immediately. This mini kiosk can apparently play games for a nominal charge in case young diners (or bored dates) need something to pass the time.  Because our food appeared at our table rather rapidly, we didn't get a chance to play. We ordered the Sriracha shrimp appetizer to start (which is apparently a 'limited-time only' item). While it seemed like a misnomer for something that tasted nothing like Sriracha, we had few complaints. The cornmeal-dusted shrimp were freshly fried and nicely paired with the handmade chips underneath but for $7, it seemed like a pretty paltry serving size. I was happy to see a Garden burger on the menu for vegetarians (with Boca burgers available for vegans) and found it to be just fine. Each burger order comes with a choice of sides, many of which are 'bottomless' and can technically be refilled as many times as you wish. I asked for fries, which turned out to be of the steak variety. Warm and crunchy, the fries were largely inoffensive but far from spectacular. I was also surprised at how few came with the meal; however, my two subsequent requests for refills were completed amicably and without delay.  While I found the whole meal to be far from outstanding, the service was fantastic. Our server checked on us several times throughout the meal to clear plates or to deliver refills of food and drink. Even the manager dropped by to make sure everything was going well with our meals. When we were ready to go, there was no need to wait for a check. The aforementioned tablet on the table allowed us to see the total, calculate a tip, pay with a card, and even print a receipt - easiest checkout ever (diners paying with cash would still need to go through their servers). I would recommend Red Robin for a quick meal that hovers just a shade above fast food. Otherwise, there are definitely better burgers to be had elsewhere.
Hit or miss... usually good and fresh, occasionally not so.  Love the fries when fresh and hot!!

Terrible experience tonight with a To Go order. We ordered 2 Cobb salads at 7:15. We were told they'd be ready in 13 minutes. Well, we finally got them at 7:50 and then they weren't right when we got home. 1 salad had no avocado the other had no bacon or blue cheese. How hard is it to make 2 Cobb salads? The bartender should have called the manager knowing how long we waited at the bar.

Walked in, had to wait for a few before our table became ready and then went to the table. Had an appetizer,  had our meal and a bucket of never ending sweet potato fries.  It was ALL good.  Every bite.   It was 13.99 for 5he hamburger, and condiments.   Sweet Potato fries are extra.  Regular fries come with the hamburger.   It was delicious. Sarah L. took care of us and we had a never ending supply of ice tea,  mandarin oranges for the kids and a great crew at the restaurant.  I was impressed with the crew and how they had fun with my granddaughters.   Lovely place.  Meals are expensive 13.99 per Hamburger.   Peter

This was my first visit to Red Robin's Gourmet Burgers. I was greeted very warmly by Cat and she made me feel special and welcome.   Sadly the welcome in was the best part of my entire experience .   The server was welcoming at all.  She did not smile or really even make eye contact.  She took my drink order then disappeared quickly .   She brought me my drink 5 minutes later and disappeared again.  It was about 10 minutes before she came back to take my order.   Once my bacon cheeseburger arrived I could tell immediately the quality was off a lot! I swear this burger was in the same class as Burger King!  It had a previously frozen thin tasteless meat patty with tons of mayo and shredded lettuce and a pickle slice with two paper thin strips of bacon that were laid in a X on the tasteless patty.  The bottomless steak fries were your normal Walmart generic brand fries with no salt or seasoning that was noticeable and there were about 10 fries on my plate. After eating what I could.. yes I ate it, I was hungry!  I paid my $11.40 for this less than mediocre meal (not including $6.80 for 22oz beer). I liked the beer it had taste!  I can in good heart never return without worry that I may have missed something on the menu that may tasty.  I can pretty much guarantee if they can't make a good burger (when that is the main attraction) then nothing else will be worth the effort or money.

Environment: Not good for large groups. Longer wait time it seems and the circular tables look awkward and cramped. Family friendly atmosphere.  Service: Sub par. Our waitress was friendly but my boyfriend had to remind her three times to grab his beer from the bar.  Food: The actual burgers were delicious. I really enjoyed the Buzz Mac and cheese tavern. Fries were meh. They weren't special. Needs more seasoning overall and definitely more salt! I am disappointed that the fries aren't good at a restaurant that advertises "bottomless fries".  Price: Outrageous. Some burgers on the menu were listed in the $15+ range. That is too fancy for a place like Red Robin. I'm glad I opted for an average priced one ($10) because it was just as good. I think they're overpriced in general. Overall food was good, service and environment were mediocre, and absolutely overpriced. We had a gift card today but will probably not be back. There are many burger joints around Spring where it won't cost you $40 for lunch.

We usually come here but this evening decided not to give our money to this establishment. The customer service was POOR! Sydney was the hostess and she was incredibly RUDE. She initially saw us and walked until my husband asked if they were open- (we walked in at 9:09pm.)  Sydney responded by saying "Idk, what time is it?" Then she grabbed the appropriate menus and walked away--- she didn't even ask us to "follow her." I usually don't like to complain and rarely give ONE STAR ratings, but that was just ridiculous. Please train your employees to have their best customer service regardless of the time of day.

We arrived at 6:10 on a Monday evening. We were seated immediately. At 6:25, I asked the greeter to send a server to us. At 6:30, I asked for a manager.   Manager never came but about 5 mins later the server arrived. No one even acknowledged the lack of service. Ironically several tables around us managed to get drinks and food. The family behind us to be seated, finished their meal and left about the same time our food arrived. Doesn't really matter how the food tasted at this point.

Ordered from Doordash. Didn't get the reds taverns sauce or the cod and shrimp I was promised, also ordered putine fries and got a cold side of mushrooms on the side of steak fries and coleslaw that I didn't order or want. Since I ordered the Nantucket with putine fries and was called from this number+12815280026 and said I would get cod and shrimp. I got 2 chicken strips and cold fried shrimp. All the food was delivered cold. Extremely disappointed from the dine experience I had previously had a few weeks ago.

Waited 15 min to be seated and we asked about alll the empty tables and the lady said she had to wait until someone else came?  No one ever came and we finally got seated. 13 empty tables. The two in the picture were right next to the podium. We weren't the only family waiting either. I don't understand Only thing saving this from being a 1 star was christy. She was fantastic.  Read your review and act.

Terrible dining experience.  Food was less than average, the place was dirty, server disapeared so forget about endless anything. They store high chairs, packages of napkins, condiments and silverware trays in a makeshift storage area in the dining room, next to 3 different table. Really unique ambience!  Restaurant is simply poorly managed at all levels.  Don't waste your time or money, there are much better places right around the corner.

I have always been a Red Robin fanatic but gradually have lessened my visits as prices went up and burger size decreased.  This location is closer to home than the Woodlands one, but I have never gone there.  I decided to give it a try after a movie a few weeks ago and was not impressed.  The hostess staff is a bit slow, goofy, and could use a bit more training on customer service.  Our server was mediocre but attentive.  Even the manager seemed nice when he came over, but something about the location was just a miss.  I am also NEVER cold, so to get goosebumps means it was freezing in there.  The Whiskey River burgers had their usual taste but I absolutely hate the tiny portions of fries for an establishment that prides itself on bottomless fries.  I shouldn't have to ask for more fries so often and I make it a point of duty not to waste food.  What's with only getting about 10 fries at a time?  I feel like they should be almost on demand, especially because it was not as if the restaurant was about to close anytime soon.  I shared my experience with a coworker and they also said they weren't thrilled with the location after their credit card information had been compromised through a manual transaction.  Soooo.....absolutely won't be back and will stick to the Woodlands location that I have been going to for over 10 years.

I have no complaints with the food here, ever. The service at this location is absolutely horendous. I have probally eaten here about 4-6 times in the last 12 months and each time we have probally waited 5+ min for the hostess to show up and seat us. Yesterday it took around 1 hour to get our food AFTER the order was put in. Previous times I would show up to order togo food at the bar and experience very very long waits as well for anyone to even show up.

I love the food at Red Robin but this is absolutely the LAST time I will ever eat at this location. We came in after seeing Star Wars on Christmas Eve and were in a good mood. By the time we left, I was almost in tears! Our meals took over  30 minutes to arrive and mine was completely wrong! Ten minutes later, they brought back an under cooked tiny piece of chicken and a horrible mushy fruit salad. The meal was inedible. No manager to be seen anywhere! I was beyond furious. I will not be back...EVER. My advice is to steer clear of this location.
